items.title: LG is announcing its own Frame-style TV at CES
items.author: John.Higgins

items.title: GOG's Steam-alternative PC game store is leaving CD Projekt, staying DRM-free
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Co-founder Michał Kiciński buys GOG from CD Projekt for $25.2M, taking control of the storefront and GOG Galaxy.
- The deal preserves GOG's DRM-free stance and a focus on preserving classics and permanent ownership, while leaning into retro-inspired titles.
- CD Projekt will continue to sell existing games on GOG, and the GOG-CD Projekt relationship stays the same.

items.title: Turn your PC into a Super Nintendo with Epilogue's new USB dock
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Epilogue unveils the SN Operator, a USB cartridge slot to play and archive SNES/SFC games on PCs, Macs and handhelds using original carts.
- Preorders start Dec 30 at 12 PM ET for $59.99; shipping planned for April 2026; Playback app includes a built-in SNES emulator and cartridge authentication.
- Works with any cartridge playable in Nintendo hardware; back up only cartridges you own; backups can include save data for continued play.

items.title: How to tweak your online platform algorithms
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Platforms let you steer recommendations by signaling what to see more or less and by pruning your history.
- Each network offers tailored controls (Facebook/Instagram: Not interested, Unfollow; X, TikTok, YouTube, Reddit, Bluesky, Tumblr: multiple menus) to retrain the feed.
- The article ends with a CTA for more stories via a personalized homepage and email updates, credited to Jess Weatherbed.

items.title: Beats’ new Powerbeats Fit earbuds are down to $180
items.author: Barbara Krasnoff
items.summary:
- Beats Powerbeats Fit on sale around $179.99 at Amazon, Best Buy and B&H (lowest price yet), with redesigned 20% more flexible wing tip, H1 chip, ANC, IPX4 and up to seven hours play.
- Pixel Watch 4 (41mm) now $299.99 at major retailers; battery life a day and a half with replaceable battery and screen.
- Apple Pencil Pro for iPad on sale for $94.97; pressure sensitivity, double-tap tool switching, gyroscope features, and squeeze gestures.

items.title: This experimental camera can focus on everything at once
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- CMU researchers created a computational spatially-varying autofocus system using a Lohmann lens pair and a phase-only spatial light modulator to give each pixel adjustable focus.
- The method uses contrast-detection and phase-detection autofocus to locate sharp regions and drive depth-aware refocusing for simultaneous multi-depth sharpness.
- Still experimental and not in consumer cameras, with potential for microscopy, VR depth, and better scene understanding in autonomous systems; commercial availability could be years away.

items.title: The best shows to watch on HBO Max from 2025
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- HBO Max's 2025 lineup spans romance, drama, comedy, and genre; highlights include Heated Rivalry, I Love LA, The Pitt, Adventure Time: Fionna and Cake S2, Welcome to Derry, Harley Quinn S5, Mad Men 4K, White Lotus S3, and The Last of Us S2.
- Peacemaker Season 2 adds a twist that rewards rewatching and could end its standalone run; Crave orders a second Heated Rivalry.
- The slate reflects prestige drama, big-concept genres, and fan favorites amid HBO Max's uncertain future.

items.title: Xiaomi’s 17 Ultra Leica edition has a rotatable camera zoom
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Xiaomi's 17 Ultra Leica Edition adds a built-in rotating zoom ring on the camera island, Leica branding, a textured side finish, and accessories; otherwise identical. 
- The ring is programmable for exposure or focus; Leica tweaks and a lens cap/cloth accompany the edition. 
- Core specs: SD8 Gen 5, up to 1TB, 16GB RAM, 6.9" OLED, 6,800mAh; 50MP main (1" sensor, f/1.7) and 200MP tele with 3.2x–4.3x zoom; ¥6,999 (standard) / ¥7,999 (Leica); global launch in 2026.

items.title: Windows on Arm had another good year
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- Snapdragon X improved Windows on Arm in 2024-25 with native/Prism apps, AVX/AVX2 emulation, and better gaming support.
- For most users it's viable, but some software and high-end games still lag behind x86; midrange Surface laptops offer strong value.
- Looking to 2026, X2 plus Lunar Lake/Strix Point and Nvidia Arm GPU rumors could reshape future Windows laptop buying decisions.

items.title: I’m The Verge’s Senior Internet Typist, ask me anything while Nilay’s away!
items.author: Elizabeth Lopatto
items.summary:
- Lopatto describes her broad Verge beat: tech, business, culture, policy, and outdoorsy gear.
- Since 2014 she's The Verge's science editor and writes about human behavior, markets, and legal issues.
- Verge subscribers can ask questions in an AMA, with answers starting at 1 PM ET.

items.title: Google Photos is coming to Samsung TVs in 2026
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Samsung will add Google Photos to its TVs starting March 2026, featuring Memories and a six-month exclusivity.
- After the six-month window, other providers may gain access; in H2 2026 Google Photos search and AI tools (Create with AI, Remix, Photo to Video) and topic-based Personalized Results will roll out.
- Sign-in with a Google account is required; there may not be a native Google Photos TV app yet, and Samsung aims to weave Photos into a cinematic TV experience.

items.title: LG announces new UltraGear evo gaming monitors with AI upscaling
items.author: Terrence O’Brien
items.summary:
- LG unveils the UltraGear evo line ahead of CES, focusing on 5K resolution and AI upscaling across three flagships: 39GX950B, 27GM950B and 52G930B.
- The 39-inch GX9 is a 21:9 5K2K OLED ultrawide capable of full 5K at 165 Hz (or 330 Hz at WFHD); the 27GM950B uses New MiniLEDs for brighter images with less blooming; the 52-inch G9 is a 12:9 curved display delivering 240 Hz native 5K2K.
- All three will be shown at CES with pricing/availability not announced; the GM9 panel underpins Apple’s Pro Display XDR, with an update expected soon.

items.title: You need to read the subversive cosmic horror novella The Ballad of Black Tom
items.author: Terrence O’Brien
items.summary:
- Lovecraft’s mythos strengths contrasted with weaker dialogue/character work; LaValle reimagines Red Hook to critique racism and policing.
- Tommy Tester, a Black Harlem hustler with magic, anchors a lean narrative; interludes with his father deepen motive and agency.
- Vengeance is cathartic yet indiscriminate, with hints of apocalyptic consequences that expand Lovecraft’s mythos.

items.title: The terrible Nintendo controller that helped make VR happen
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Examines the Power Glove as an early, body-based gaming controller that captured VR optimism even as it failed commercially.
- Traces its journey from research project to toy and a Nintendo-branded product after a pivotal pitch, and explains why it flopped.
- The hosts test the glove on air and discuss how its arc foreshadowed later Nintendo hardware and the broader VR era.

items.title: Ubisoft shuts down ‘Rainbow Six Siege’ servers following hack
items.author: Terrence O’Brien
items.summary:
- Ubisoft confirmed Rainbow Six Siege was compromised, triggering a shutdown of servers and the marketplace while the issue is resolved.
- Hackers reportedly gained control of core systems, able to ban/unban players, message the ban ticker, unlock items, and grant 2 billion R6 Credits and Renown.
- Ubisoft noted credits purchased after 11:00 AM UTC Saturday would be rolled back; players who spent credits before that would not be punished; service restoration status ongoing.

items.title: The best PS5 games from 2025
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- The Verge notes a shift toward multiplatform play with Sony's high‑quality exclusives continuing in 2025, plus a cloud-streaming PS Portal expanding access to 2,000+ games.
- Highlights include Final Fantasy Tactics remaster with an expansive job system, Ghost of Tsushima sequel refining open‑world and narrative, and Death Stranding sequel bringing new setting and cast.
- Also spotlighted are quirky titles like Baby Steps (DualSense-driven movement) and Lumines Arise (Lumines + Tetris Effect with a demanding flow state).

items.title: Two new wireless Samsung speakers for 2026 lean into aesthetics
items.author: John.Higgins
items.summary:
- Samsung expands its art-as-design Music Studio line with a CES 2026 debut, designed with Erwan Bouroullec, continuing camouflage-inspired aesthetics.
- Music Studio 5 features a 4-inch woofer and dual tweeters; Music Studio 7 is a 3.1.1-channel model that can run standalone, as a stereo pair, or with Samsung Wi‑Fi speakers, soundbars, or TVs via Q‑Symphony.
- Both models support up to 24-bit/96kHz Hi‑Res audio and use AI Dynamic Bass Control, with a nod to Samsung's timeless dot concept and improved tuning.

items.title: Sam Altman is hiring someone to worry about the dangers of AI
items.author: Terrence O’Brien
items.summary:
- OpenAI is hiring a Head of Preparedness to lead evaluations, threat models, and mitigations for a scalable safety pipeline.
- The role implements the preparedness framework, guards for self-improving systems, and safety around bio-capable releases.
- The Verge notes concerns about AI harms, including mental-health risks and misinformation, reported by Terrence O’Brien on Dec 27, 2025.

items.title: Pixel 10 phones and Switch 2 games round out this week’s best deals
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Verge highlights deals on Pixel 10 phones, AirTag, Nintendo Switch games, and accessories; Pixel 10 base $499, 10 Pro $649, 10 Pro XL $799; Qi2 charging; Pixel 10 deals via Amazon code PIXEL10; Switch titles discounted up to 50% through Jan 4. 
- Anker power banks and accessories: 25,000mAh ~ $87.99 with cables and LCD, Laptop Power Bank ~ $87.99 with high output; Twelve South AirFly Pro 2 on sale at $49.99; Echo Spot discounted. 
- Extra promos: AirTag $19; sale availability at Amazon and Best Buy; most deals run through January 4.

items.title: 8 great games for your Steam Deck from 2025
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Ball x Pit blends roguelike, Breakout and city-building with unlockable characters and short runs under 15 minutes.
- Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is a story-driven RPG with turn-based combat and strong music, Deck verified.
- Hades II expands with a new protagonist and routes; Hollow Knight: Silksong and other indie titles round out a strong 2025 Steam Deck slate.

items.title: Trump’s war on offshore wind faces another lawsuit
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- Dominion Energy sues to block the 90-day offshore-wind pause, calling it unlawful and an overreach.
- The suit cites rising Virginia data-center demand and warns delays will raise costs; Interior Sec. Burgum is named a defendant.
- It follows earlier challenges to offshore-wind actions and ongoing questions about national-security and radar-interference concerns.

items.title: Rodeo is an app for making plans with friends you already have
items.author: Terrence O’Brien
items.summary: - Rodeo is an invite-only iOS beta that uses AI to plan activities with existing friends, cutting friction from busy schedules and chats.\n- It ingests posts, venue pages, or group-chat screenshots to auto-create plans, pull showtimes, and allow ticket purchases, with nudges to invite friends.\n- Marketed as a 'second brain' for social planning, it offers collaborative lists where others can contribute, applying Notion/Obsidian-like organization to friends’ plans.

items.title: Framework announces another memory price hike — and it likely won’t be its last

items.title: The 10 best shows to stream on Amazon Prime Video from 2025
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Prime Video's 2025 slate bundles new seasons and spinoffs across major series (Reacher S2, Fallout S2, Hazbin Hotel S2, Bosch: Legacy S3, Ballard, Invincible S3, Gen V S2, Gundam GQuuuuuuX, The Girlfriend).
- Expanded universes span crime, post-apocalyptic, mecha, and supernatural tales with deeper stakes.
- Notable adds include Ballard's LAPD cold‑case focus and cross‑series threads.

items.title: LG teases a new chore-completing home robot
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- LG shows CLOiD, a chore-focused home robot for CES, with two articulated arms and five-finger hands.
- Features a display, camera, sensors, voice interaction, navigation, and LG's Affectionate Intelligence AI.
- Early images hint at trash-takeout tasks; more details to be revealed at CES.

items.title: I re-created Google’s cute Gemini ad with my own kid’s stuffie, and I wish I hadn’t
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Verge tests Gemini with the child's stuffed lamb Buddy to see if AI can locate a replacement and craft travel imagery during backorder.
- It notes long internal reasoning prompts, misreads, uncanny outputs, and ethical concerns about using a child's image in AI ads.
- Overall, Gemini can approximate ad feats but requires iterative prompting and is constrained by guardrails.

items.title: Hollywood cozied up to AI in 2025 and had nothing good to show for it
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Gen‑AI use expanded in 2025 amid lawsuits and partnerships; outputs remained unimpressive; startups like Asteria and Showrunner tried to legitimize AI in development.
- Disney signed a billion-dollar OpenAI deal for Sora to generate AI videos from IP; Netflix issued AI guidelines; Amazon faced localization and recap missteps.
- Industry warned of a 'slop era'; Disney urged ChatGPT use; audience value for AI remains lukewarm and broad Hollywood adoption looms.

items.title: Anker’s beefy Laptop Power Bank has returned to its Black Friday low
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- Anker's 25,000mAh/90Wh Laptop Power Bank is $87.99 at Amazon and Walmart, matching late‑Nov price records with a $47 discount.
- 600 g, USB-A/C, charges 2 devices up to 165W or 3–4 devices up to 130W; carry-on under 100Wh; LCD shows remaining charge, output, and temperature; includes InstaCord A1695 retractable USB-C cable with passthrough charging.
- Other deals include Bose SoundLink Home speaker around $179, Roku Streaming Stick 4K $24.99, Xbox Series X $599.99; post‑Black Friday quieter environment and tariff caveats.

items.title: Sony’s souped-up PlayStation 5 Pro is $100 off for the rest of today
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- PS5 Pro around $689.99 with about $100 off; sale ends Dec 25 at 3:00 a.m. ET.
- Pro features 2 TB storage, largest PS5 GPU, digital-only by default, and PSSR AI upscaling.
- Upgrade ease varies by title; sale window makes higher fidelity and performance appealing for many buyers.

items.title: The best shows and movies to stream on Netflix in 2025
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Netflix 2025 expands ad-supported tiers, adds live-TV (WWE) and KPop Demon Hunters, a hit with a global sing-along and cross-media hype.
- Death By Lightning: a four-episode Garfield drama with a top ensemble (Shannon, Offerman) exploring incendiary rhetoric and violence.
- Notables include Guillermo del Toro’s Frankenstein, Knives Out benchmark, Stranger Things final season, Squid Game finale, and Sean Combs: The Reckoning.

items.title: In 2025, AI became a lightning rod for gamers and developers
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- In 2025, generative AI moved from prototypes to major releases, with studios publicly embracing use and indie devs signaling AI-free status.
- Proponents say AI can accelerate development by merging images, text, audio and video; critics cite quality risks, labor displacement, and contested asset ownership.
- The debate continued as indie studios face economic pressure, ethics and environmental concerns, ensuring AI remains a lightning rod in a tech-driven industry.

items.title: Apple is going to allow third-party app stores in Brazil, too
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- CADE approves third‑party app stores and external payments on iOS in Brazil; Apple has 105 days to implement, penalties up to R$150 million.
- Fees: 25% general commission (10% for some programs); 5% Apple payment fee; external routing may add up to 15% if the app links to its own site.
- Apple warns of security/privacy risks; safeguards for youths remain; Europe/Japan regulators have moved toward openings; impact on developers and users.

items.author: Sheena Vasani

items.title: Samsung’s 2026 gaming monitors promise 6K, 3D, and up to 1,040Hz
items.author: Emma Roth

items.title: 007 First Light’s release date gets shaken up
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: - IO Interactive has delayed 007 First Light by two months to May 27, 2026 to polish for day-one quality.\n- The game is described as a James Bond origin story featuring globe-trotting action, spycraft, gadgets, and car chases, with Lenny Kravitz and Gemma Chan set to star.\n- Updates are planned for early 2026 after the June trailer and September gameplay deep dive.

items.title: Judge blocks Texas app store age verification law
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary: • A federal judge blocked Texas SB 2420, ruling it would likely violate the First Amendment and effectively mandate pervasive age verification for app stores.\n• The injunction leaves the merits undecided and notes the law’s method may not be closely tied to its goals, with Texas planning an appeal.\n• The decision aligns with a broader wave of state and federal interest in app-store age-gating involving major platforms and lawmakers.

items.title: These great digital gifts will arrive just in time for Christmas
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Digital gifts arrive on time and fit recipients’ interests, via subscriptions and gift cards for film/TV, gaming, and travel. 
- Categories include Travel (National Parks pass, GetYourGuide), Wellness (Peloton, Headspace, Fitbit), Food (Blue Apron, HelloFresh, Goldbelly), Music, Books, and Creatives (Kindle Unlimited, MasterClass, Adobe CC). 
- The Verge argues digital access offers thoughtful choice over generic cards and highlights ongoing deals and broad retailer gift cards.

items.title: DOJ appears to bungle Epstein Files redactions
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- Lauren Feiner reports the DOJ's Epstein-file redactions are delaying release and may reveal information that should be obscured.
- Redacted blocks reportedly show payments to models and an immigration-lawyer linked to a forced-marriage defense tied to immigration status, per the 2022 USVI complaint.
- A photo related to the case was briefly removed then restored over privacy concerns, underscoring ongoing transparency debates about Epstein materials.

items.title: Watch lists are broken. Federation could fix them.
items.author: Janko Roettgers
items.summary: - Watch lists are fragmented across Netflix, Hulu, Google TV, Plex and more; syncing is inconsistent and deep links can fail on devices.\n- Federated watch lists would share data across services with a master list and real-time updates, enabling auto-categorization and cross-service playlists.\n- Roettgers calls for open data access and remixable APIs, arguing for a data-open future despite uncertainty.

items.title: New York’s landmark AI safety bill was defanged — and universities were part of the push against it
items.author: Hayden Field

items.title: Dozens of Flock AI camera feeds were just out there
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary: - A misconfiguration left 60+ Flock livestreams publicly accessible without authentication, exposing live feeds and up to 30 days of archives from Condor cameras.\n- Streams could pan, tilt, and zoom and allowed access to logs, settings, deletion of footage, and diagnostics via admin panels.\n- Discovered by Benn Jordan and 404 Media via Shodan; Flock says the issue was limited and has been remedied, with ongoing partnerships like Ring.

items.title: Belkin’s camera grip power bank is a few upgrades away from being a must-have
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The Belkin Stage PowerGrip attaches magnetically to Qi2/MagSafe or Pixelsnap phones, includes a 9,300 mAh battery and a retractable USB-C cable for multi-device charging.
- It adds ergonomic benefits for one-handed photography and can stand for hands-free use, but the front-edge shutter on iOS is awkward and the grip is noticeably heavy.
- Wireless charging tops out at 7.5W and total output is shared across three devices (about 18W in tests); at $79.99 it's cheaper than premium grips but offers fewer controls.

items.title: One last holiday hurrah for the $50 off deal on the Switch 2
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Verge Deals roundup flags last-minute discounts across Nintendo, Sony, and accessories; Switch 2 bundle with Mario Kart World at $449.99.
- PS5 deal lineup includes Digital Slim $399.99 and Pro $649.99 with tariff adjustments; DJI Mic Mini wireless kit around $79.
- Helinox Chair One discounted to $64.97; limited quantities possible; Verge urges signing up for weekly tested deals.

items.title: How Last Samurai Standing adds kinetic action to the Battle Royale formula
items.author: Geoffrey Bunting
items.summary:
- Junichi Okada stars as producer and action designer, guiding fight design from script to screen and coordinating with camera, wardrobe, makeup and editing for coherence.
- A former pop star and martial artist, he blends Kali/Jeet Kune Do with jiujitsu and dance training to shape rhythm, dō and ma in action and storytelling.
- In a bank vault duel with Sakura, the sequence unfolds in three phases—still opening take, escalating violent arc, weary final stalemate—showing concept-driven, collaborative choreography.

items.title: The Vergecast RAM Holiday Spec-tacular
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary: - Overview of RAM's history, why it enabled modern PCs, and how AI-driven demand is driving prices.\n- Hosts and guests discuss market dynamics, chip supply, and RAM shortages, plus RAM-themed games.\n- Look ahead to 2025–2026 AI RAM dynamics and a CES 2026 Vergecast live show.
